Listing lifetime: Aggregate Zone
Notes: Single lookup that contains results from black  exploit and policy lists

Zone: Lists individual IP addresses that have sent mail to spam traps And some manual added netblocks
Listing goal: Mostly Automatic with some manual additions
Nomination: For automated listings 56 days after last event  manual additions are permanent
Listing lifetime: [empty]

Zone: Lists IP addresses behaving in a way that indicates the IP is compromised  infected  proxy  VPN  TOR  malware
Listing lifetime: [empty]

Zone: Lists IP addresses that should not be connecting directly to MX  such as residential IPs etc
Listing lifetime: Lists ranges that have generic or templated rDNS Individual IPs can be delisted immediately via web

Zone: Lists domains seen in spam hitting traps
Listing lifetime: Can be used as an RHSBL and a URIBL

Zone: Lists domains that are newly observed (first use)
Listing lifetime: Based on historical passive DNS data  lists domains first seen in the wild within the last 25 hours)

Zone: Lists short URLs (SHA1 hashed) seen in traps
Listing lifetime: Created to handle popular shorteners that are misused to hide domains from blacklisting

Zone: Lists URLs of online drive services (SHA1 hashed) seen in traps
Listing lifetime: Current only listing Google Drive and Yandex Disk URLs that are used to avoid domain blacklisting

Listing goal: Lists IP ranges belonging to officially published abuse addresses that either bounce or request not to receive abuse notices The aim of this list is to block companies that openly shrug their abuse responsibilities
Nomination: Abuse addresses that fail to be deliverable for 3 out of the last 7 days are automatically added
Listing lifetime: Lifetime listing or automatic once mail delivery resumes in the case of automated additions

Zone: Lists IP ranges belonging to abuse addresses that have failed to handle abuse issues for at least 30 days The aim of this list is to hold companies accountable for the abuse that originates from their networks rather than just ignoring it
Listing goal: IP ranges belonging to abuse addresses with reported and unresolved issues for at least 30 days are automatically added
Nomination: Automatic removal is done once all hosts with abuse unresolved for 30 days have been clean for 2 weeks
Listing lifetime: Data for lists are generated from live data collected by the WebIron web security platform

Zone: Lists single IP addresses recently attacking websites and servers
Listing goal: Lists IP addressed belonging to hosts that have attacked at least twice within the last 48 hours
Nomination: Automatic removal is done once a host has gone 24 hours without an incident
Listing lifetime: Data for lists are generated from live data collected by the WebIron web security platform

Zone: Contains IP addresses and ranges from BABL  CABL  and STABL
Listing lifetime: [empty]

Zone: Web Crawler IP lookup used to match user agents with known crawler IP addresses Data from this list is considered BETA
Listing lifetime: This DNSRBL contains valid and legitimate crawlers Matching alone should not be used for blocking

Listing goal: Extremely conservative list of single IP4 addresses that produce exclusively spam/malware as indicated by the GBUdb IP Reputation system Most systems should be able to safely reject connections based on this list
Nomination: Automatic IPs are added when the GBUdb "cloud" statistics reach a probability figure that indicates 95% of messages produce a spam/malware pattern match and a confidence figure that indicates sufficient data to trust the probability data
Listing lifetime: Automatic Continuous while reputation statistics remain bad Warning Produces false positives  and has no remedy/removal process IPs are dropped quickly if the statistics improve (within an hour) IPs are dropped within 36 hours (typ) if no more messages are seen (dead zombie)
Notes: Source data is derived from a global network of Message Sniffer[1] filtering nodes in realtime Truncate data is updated from statistics every 10 minutes

Listing goal: Single IP addresses which only send UBE Specializing in snowshoe spam and other 'under the radar' spams which evade many other DNSBLs Has FPlevel comparable to Zen
Nomination: Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real person's mailbox)  with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Listing lifetime: Typically an automatic expiration 11 days after the last abuse was seen  but with some exceptions
Notes: Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing Removal requests are manually reviewed and processed without fees

Zone: Lists /24 blocks of IP addresses which usually only send UBE and containing at least several addresses which are confirmed emitters of junk mail Collateral listings are kept to a minimum because subsections are often carved from /24 listings when spammers and legit senders share the same /24 block
Listing goal: Automatic once at least several IP addresses from a given block are individually listed on ivmSIP  with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Nomination: Expiration time increases to many weeks as the fraction of IP addresses in the /24 block in question sending junk mail increases
Listing lifetime: Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees

Zone: Comparable to uriblcom and surblorg  this is a list of IP addresses and domains which are used by spammers in the clickable links found in the body of spam messages
Listing goal: Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real person's mailbox)  with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Nomination: Typically an automatic expiration several weeks after the last abuse was seen
Listing lifetime: Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees

Listing goal: strikethrough|Lists all types of open (publicly accessible) proxies
Nomination: strikethrough|Automated listing through crawling of websites
Listing lifetime: strikethrough|As long as proxy is verified open (automated)[2] Service discontinued mid 2014
Notes: strikethrough|Time between verifications increases exponentially in relation to the number of times the host was verified an open proxy

Listing goal: Single IP addresses that send mail to spamtraps
Nomination: Automatic by a cluster of more than 60 trapservers [4]
Listing lifetime: Automatic expiration 7 days after the last abuse was seen  optionally express delisting for a small fee
Notes: UCEPROTECT's primary and the only independent list

Zone: Allocations with exceeded UCEPROTECT Level 1 listings
Nomination: Automatic removal as soon as Level 1 listings decrease below Level 2 listing border  optionally express delisting (for a fee)
Listing lifetime: Fully depending on Level 1

Zone: ASN's with excessive UCEPROTECT Level 1 listings
Nomination: Automatic removal as soon as Level 1 listings decrease below Level 3 listing border  optionally express delisting (fee)
Listing lifetime: Fully depending on Level 1

Listing lifetime: N/A (See individual zones)
Notes: Aggregate zone (all aggregates and what they include are listed on SORBS)[5]

Listing goal: Detects viruses by behavior using fake high MX and tracking nonuse of QUIT

Blacklist operator: Heise Zeitschriften Verlag GmbH & Co KG  hosted by manitu GmbH
Listing goal: Lists single IPs (no IP ranges) that send spam to spamtraps Lists mailhosts  rather than domains  and thus blocks entire hosting providers and ISPs
Nomination: Automated listing due to spamtrap hits Exceptions apply to bounces  NDRs and whitelisted IPs
Listing lifetime: 12 hours after last listing or until self delisting
Notes: TXT records provide information of listing incident  NiX Spam also provides hashes for fuzzy checksum plugin (iXhash) for SpamAssassin

Nomination: IP addresses can be reported as known spam sources by users  additionally automated listing if spam arrives at the mailservers of inpsde
Listing lifetime: IP addresses are listed until they are removed manually via the website
Notes: A and TXT records are available for each entry; Removal is free after 30 days for automatic additions and after 7 days for manual additions; otherwise removal fee is at least EUR 1000

Listing goal: IPAddresses who Attacks other Server/Honeypots over ssh  imap  smtp  ftp  web  rfi  sqli  ddos
Nomination: Automatic over Honeypots and with over 515 Users and 630 Servers from blocklistde via Fail2Ban or own scripts
Listing lifetime: Automatic 48 Hours after the last Attack But earlier remove is available over the DelistLink
Notes: Services are free Source data is from HoneypotSystems and over 515 User with 630 Servern there reports Attacks with Fail2Ban

Listing lifetime: Automatic expiry (varies by type); webpage allows delisting
Notes: Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees

Listing goal: Spam sources from email  forums  referrer spam and dictionary attacks
Listing lifetime: Twelve months unless ISPs request removal earlier
Notes: By request ISPs can provide request exclusion

Listing goal: strikethrough|IP addresses used to send spam to traps
Nomination: strikethrough|spamtraps  in order to avoid abusive reports (Competitors  false positive  etc) only MegaRBL team can add an IP to the list
Listing lifetime: strikethrough|Until delisting requested  which is impossible
Notes: strikethrough|Removal requests are impossible  since the necessary login after registration fails every time So without possibility to log in there is really no way to place a removal request Once listed on MegaRBL an IP stays there forever Maybe preparation for upcoming business model to earn much money with a removal service Should not be considered a serious source for blacklist info Domain expired in November  2019 and service is discontinued[12]

Nomination: List of IP addresses that sends spam or causing troubles with botnets or phishing
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested
Notes: Removal requests will be investigated and processed within 24 hours of submission Previously known as IPrangenet RBL Project

Listing goal: Collection of Bad Actors from various sources  Works great with PiHole for personal use

Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested
Notes: Removal requests will be investigated Contact details provided

Nomination: Provides a list of IP addresses which are sending spam The Barracuda Reputation system uses automated collection methods to add and delete IP addresses from the BRBL
Listing lifetime: Until delisting requested
Notes: Requires registration of administrator and hosts to use Removal requests are typically investigated and processed within 12 hours of submission if provided with a valid explanation

Listing goal: Bad reputation  difficult to identify the responsible  dynamic IP  SLAAC flag without genuine email service and inappropriate use of the URL
Nomination: Provides a list of IPv4/IPv6 addresses and domains which are sending spam or phishing

Notes: The feedback system runs at SMTP layer See https//spfblnet/en/feedback
